content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Well done.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle

As someone with only basic knowledge of Unicode values and how to alter them, this was a good challenge. I took a little while to complete it, but I'm sure an experienced coder can complete it in under 15 mins. Good puzzle, well done.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good clash.

a nice goal, but for begginners only, and it might already exist. The 'hardest' part is to learn how to change ascii values to get the letters to move, which is naturral in C (or other memory based code) but need to be learned in python.

The puzzle would still be good for a 'shortest' clash of code and maybe the goal is a bit long for a 'fastest', but that's only my opinion.

Caesar cipher is way over done.  Please consider creating a different puzzle or changing this one.  Some different ideas are: one-time code, given a known word in an encoded text find the Caesar shift number, or make this puzzle a reverse only puzzle

Goal
* Please fix the typo: "technic" => "technique".

* Please fix the typo: "beggining" => "beginning".

* Please change "'Z'" to "{{Z}}" (without the quotation marks), and then add a full-stop.

* Please add "For example, if the input is {{AZ}}:" above "First letter is".

* Please change "is a 'A'" to "is {{A}}".

* Please format "Z" and "Y" as {{constants}} in the last sentence.

Constraints
* Please change "[[msg]]" to "length of [[msg]]".

Thanks.
This is my first contribution, definitely needed help. Thanks for all those advises and conventions.
Hi, thanks for your time. Quick question, how do you see other puzzles. I use the search bar, and only could find 1 from BetaCorn. That way, next time I don't propose something already done too much.
This is not a straightforward Caesar cipher. This clash requires the use of multiple shifts.
Oh... ok. Nevermind my comment then.

There used to be a tool (but I don't know what happened to it) to search clashes.  That said, I've been on this platform and seen hundreds of caesar cipher submits, so that one I know just off hand.  I think generally for class of code there isn't too much worry about duplication (other than caesar cipher).  For puzzles, you can use the search at the top.  Cheers

All the ceasar code Coc that i could found :
- https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/4496138280eddd3a29bffcfeb31c53bc3457b
- https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/441691766f0ea28d43a0bfe51c714e34f8891
- https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/34005b73233d64ac49f1cafcd591db47d6e71
- https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/4897be7273bc5438a5cf42f6a6936d9ca4e6
- https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/654543aa02f61ac0ade41de0fb81f761d6c64
- https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/439054a07e1d24a1de855718c111d678011a9

But all of them are different and did't want you to code the exact same thing, but yes there is a lot of caesar code Coc. But there is over 3000 publish Coc. Nobody did this already, you can look what other do with the link list
